Posts.Content: I had breast cancer in year 2000.  I had a Lumpectomy, chemo & radiation.  I lost all my hair.  I took Tamoxifen for 5 years, did not have any trouble with any of it.  After the 5 years of Tamoxifen, the Oncologist who had told me during the 5 years I would never need anything after the Tamoxifen, suddenly changed his mind and put me on Aromasin.  I took Aromasin for three months and began to have very severe problems with pain in my left leg.  After going to emergency rooms and several different Doctors, I was being treated for sciata.  It continued to get worse to the point I could hardly walk or function.  I finally went to an Neurologist, who said I had a non-functioning left sciata nerve.  He said this condition was so rare he couldn't begin to explain what happened.  I continued to deal with this condition every day.  I've gone to many Drs. have had many medical tests with no answers.  I got through the breast cancel just fine, but the Aromasin has changed my life forever.  Has this happened to anyone else?
Posts.Title: Hello, Breast Cancer, My Life

Posts.Content: I don't know Aromasin, seems to be causing alot of problems.  Tamoxifin has worked for so many people.  I did well on that one.  Did they remove your left breast to spare you from radiatiion  Did you get thru the chemo ok.  How long ago was your cancer?  Hope you feel better soon.  I'm in St Louis,  where do you live?
Posts.Title: Hello, Breast Cancer, My Life
